repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collection contains the records of Audubon New York.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. Please contact an archivist for more information.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The University Archives are eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The National Audubon Society sometimes simply called Audubon is a non-profit organization. It specifically dedicates its mission to environmental conservation. Members strive to protect birds and the environments that they live in. The organization is located in the United States, where it first started in 1905. It is one of the oldest environmental conservation organizations in the world. It is called the Audubon Society after John James Audubon. He was an ornithologist and a naturalist who described, painted, and cataloged birds. He then published all of his findings in Birds of America. This book was published in sections from 1827 until 1838.

Audubon has approximately 500 local divisions. Each of these divisions is an independent non-profit that is merely affiliated to the National Audubon Society. They local divisions arrange birdwatching outings and other environmental conservation concerning trips.

Audubon, with the help of Cornell University in Ithaca, New York, created an online database for bird watching called eBird. This new database helps many people who cannot be present with the organization to be able to utilize their information. On eBird, people may find new birds, share their bird sightings, and track lists of birds. This site also helps Audubon's international partners who assist birds who migrate all over the world. Some of these partners include BirdLife International, which is based in England, Bird Studies Canada, and a plethora of partners who are based in Latin America.

Audubon has agencies in New York City, and in Washington D.C., it also has state offices in 24 other states. It also operates quite a few nature centers. These centers are open to all public and are usually located in more urban settings. These locations include New York City, Phoenix, Arizona, Dallas, Texas, and Los Angeles, California.
Audubon New York is the state program of the National Audubon Society and formerly National Audubon Society of New York State.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records of Audubon New York consists of publications, flyers, and other published material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Audubon New York, 1995-2002. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Audubon New York).
